properties.description: "Our Warm Space is a welcoming environment where members of the community can come together to stay warm, connect, and enjoy a sense of belonging. It offers a safe and inclusive setting with comfortable seating, heating, and access to tea, coffee, and light refreshments. Visitors can engage in activities such as board games, group conversations, and informal socialising, fostering a supportive atmosphere for those who may feel isolated or face challenges in heating their homes. Our space embodies our commitment to community well-being and inclusivity, ensuring everyone feels valued and supported.

properties.title: Chesterfield Community Roast

properties.address: Rowsley Village Hall, Matlock, Derbyshire DE4 2EE
properties.description: We run a Community Hub every week on Tuesday mornings (we began in November 2022). We offer a welcoming space for people to meet and have hot drinks and something light to eat. We also provide papers, magazines and puzzles. We provide tea, coffee and cake ‘on a pay as you feel’ donation basis (with free tea and coffee refills). Some people like to pop in for buttered crumpets or teacakes; our ‘bacon butties’ mornings are always popular. We often have themed days, e.g., Pancake Day, where we served fresh pancakes, and also had fun events (including pancake races for children). We also have craft activities (e.g., mosaic making sets), that visitors can come and sit and do, as we have found these mindful activities help people relax, and provide a focus for people who are struggling with anxiety and mental issues. Tables are also set up in the small side room (off the main hall) to provide a ‘quiet space’ for those who find social settings difficult, and this also serves as a ‘shared working from home’ space. Free Wi-Fi is provided. We have incorporated a Parent & Toddler group into the Community Hub, which has been well used and goes from strength to strength. During the holidays we have encouraged the attendance of older siblings and provided craft activities for them to do. We are keen to promote sustainability in the community whenever we can – the GRowsley community group and local allotment holders donate excess produce. Visitors are encouraged to help themselves to these local vegetables, fruit and jam or chutney, or to exchange items e.g., blackberries and apples when in season.
properties.title: Community Hub

properties.address: Central Methodist Church, Chesterfield, Derbyshire S40 1UH
properties.description: Our Warm Space will be open every Friday, beginning 7th November 2025 until the end of March 2026, from 3.00pm - 6.00pm. We provide a warm and friendly welcome to all, with hot drinks, a warm meal, friendship, time to chat, support and signposting to other agencies for help, if required. Direct access from the street. All areas, including toilets, are wheelchair accessible. Facilities for babies and young children, including baby change area. TV screen for showing films, play video games, not mainstream TV. Cornerstone Christian Bookshop and Coffee Shop is also open every day, except Wednesday, and Sunday 10:00 - 15:00.
properties.title: Cornerstone, Central Methodist Church, Chesterfield, Derbyshire S40 1UH

properties.address: West Studios, Chesterfield, Derbyshire S41 7LL
properties.description: The warm space is called Cosy Crafts and will run every Wednesday between 2 pm and 4 pm at West Studios on Sheffield Road. The project is for people of all ages and is part of the Warm Spaces network, a UK-wide initiative that aims to help people during the cost-of-living crisis. Warm spaces are free places where people can relax, have a drink, access free Wifi, meet people and join in activities. The aim is to combat loneliness and improve wellbeing while signposting people to practical help if they need it. Cosy Crafts will have a different craft activity each week that visitors can get involved in, including Indian Block Printing, Card and Gift Bag workshop, Tissue Paper Flower Making and Glass Engraving.
properties.title: Cosy Crafts

properties.address: Level Centre, Matlock, Derbyshire DE4 2EL
properties.description: Come and join us each Friday at our crafty and creative warm space! - From 11am to 12 noon have a go at a simple, self led creative activity... anything from collage, to pebble painting, to printmaking! Activities are free and change each week. - Afterwards have a cuppa and biscuit or bring your own lunch and make use of our relaxing kitchen space. - Spend some time enjoying our fun, interactive installation Happy Trails: Welcome to Lalaland and our gallery corridor art exhibition. - If the weather is kind, head outdoors into our beautiful Biodiverse Sensory Garden or go wildlife spotting along the White Peak Loop. - Or simply come and chill out at our friendly and welcoming centre. We love having visitors to LEVEL and want to make sure that everyone has the best experience when they come to visit. Our building is a purpose-built accessible arts centre with level access, disabled parking bays, accessible toilets and many other access features - find out more here: www.levelcentre.com/access-for-all. We support breast/chest feeding and have baby change facilities. Everyone is welcome at our centre! Fridays from 11am-3pm until the end of March 2026.
properties.title: LEVEL Centre

Joanna.holland@ashgatehospice.org.uk Our Day Hospice team provides advice, education, activities and support to those with a life limiting and their family at the earliest stage of their diagnosis as possible. Anyone with a life limiting illness diagnosis can come to our Day Hospice drop-in where they can go on to access a range of services, including physiotherapy, complementary therapies, wellbeing activities and expert medical advice. Anyone coming to the Day Hospice space during the drop ins, or group support sessions can access our kitchen facility from which they can help themselves to a full range of hot drinks which are provided free of charge. We also have snacks and sandwiches available.

Market Hall, Chesterfield Sharlaine Fincham sharlainefincham@cfcct.org.uk We are proposing for the Youth Hub to provide a warm, engaging space to accommodate young people in the community. We are open for drop-in sessions for young people to come in to talk, share their concerns, play games, have fun, charge their phone, use WiFi and have the opportunity to be listened to. We would use this opportunity to consult with the young people further to establish what they would like in this space and how they would like it to be used. We would like to be able to provide a more welcoming environment for young people – bean bags/soft furnishing, etc. We already have some board games, an X-box and craft activities. We would also like to be able to provide hot drinks, snacks and food, which would be provided through the air fryer and induction hob, ensuring that all young people would be able to have something hot to eat or drink. We would work with other local organisations and providers to be able to offer sanitary products and food. The Youth Hub is also a base of support information offering sign posting to all services that support young people. Weekday afternoons from 3.00pm - 5.00pm At least 1 evening a week from 5.00pm – 8.00pm day tbc Also will be open between Christmas and New Year

Derbyshire LGBTQ+ 51 Rutland Road, Chesterfield, Derbyshire, S40 1ND LiamV@derbyshirelgbt.org.uk Each gathering will include a warm, home-cooked meal served in a relaxed and inclusive environment, where everyone is invited to share not just food, but conversation and companionship. Alongside the meal, we’ll facilitate guided discussions around LGBT+ topics, giving attendees the opportunity to explore identity, share experiences, and learn from one another in a safe and respectful setting. We’ll also open up conversations around loneliness and isolation which are issues that disproportionately affect many in the LGBT+ community, to better understand the challenges people face and work together to find meaningful ways to reduce them. Thursday 11am-3pm

hours._text: January 9th, 16th, 23rd 30th February 6th, 13th, 20th, 27th March 6th, 13th, 20th, 27th 2026 We plan to offer to build on our warm spaces last year, though we have a different venue this time. We will offer joined up activities again along with warm refreshments. Guided breathwork for low mood, anxiety, and relaxation along with discussions about personal wellness and wellbeing. This will be followed by a guided meditation. We will use the opportunity to add a theme each week to talk about and centre the activities around issues such as low mood over the winter months, experiencing anxiety, isolation, and how to stay well during the cold weather. We will listen to the people who come along and be led by how they want to use some of the talking and activities time so that we cover relevant concerns and issues people are experiencing whilst they are staying warm and socialising in a shared space. There will be time at the end to stay around if anyone needs a particular chat or any signposting.
